intro: Selliguea tatsienensis, commonly known as the Tatsienensis moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that typically grows on rocky substrates in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has a distinctive morphology with a short, upright stem and closely spaced leaves that are often covered in a layer of rhizoids. It is characterized by its ability to survive in harsh conditions due to its thick, waxy cuticle and specialized water retention structures. This moss is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential adaptations to extreme climates.
